scaffolding.env_example:
# Gemini API (Agent 1 + Agent 4)
GEMINI_API_KEY=your-gemini-api-key-here

# OpenAI API (Agent 2)
OPENAI_API_KEY=your-openai-api-key-here

# Anthropic API (Agent 3a + Agent 3b)
ANTHROPIC_API_KEY=your-anthropic-api-key-here

# Application Environment Variables
NEXT_PUBLIC_SITE_URL=http://localhost:3000
NEXT_PUBLIC_YOUTUBE_API_KEY=your-youtube-api-key-here
INFRANODUS_API_KEY=your-infranodus-api-key-here

# YouTube Stream IDs
NODVAST_YOUTUBE_ID=stream-id-1
NODSYD_YOUTUBE_ID=stream-id-2
NODOST_YOUTUBE_ID=stream-id-3
NODMIDD_YOUTUBE_ID=stream-id-4

# Event Configuration
NEXT_PUBLIC_EVENT_DAY=1
NEXT_PUBLIC_EVENT_DATES=2025-11-06,2025-11-07

# Feature Flags
NEXT_PUBLIC_ENABLE_INFRANODUS_MCP=false
NEXT_PUBLIC_ENABLE_ANALYTICS=false

claude_frontend: Create src/app/layout.tsx (root layout with Header and Footer)
Create src/app/[locale]/layout.tsx (locale-specific layout with RTL support)
Test RTL layout with Arabic and Farsi
Write unit tests for components (Jest + Testing Library)
Ensure performance budget: LCP <2.5s, CLS <0.1, JS <250KB
claude_backend: Create src/lib/youtube/client.ts (YouTube Data API v3 wrapper)
Create comprehensive API documentation in docs/api/
Write Router QoS configuration guide from plans/router_plan.md
Write OBS multi-RTMP setup guide from plans/obs_plan.md
Write YouTube channel setup guide from plans/yt_plan.md
Write InfraNodus integration guide from plans/infranodus_plan.md
Set up Playwright E2E tests configuration
Write integration tests for API routes
Implement error handling and logging utilities

parallel_execution.description: Claude Frontend (3a) and Claude Backend (3b) will execute in parallel
parallel_execution.coordination: API contracts defined in this document serve as the interface contract
parallel_execution.conflict_avoidance: Clear separation: Frontend owns src/components, Backend owns src/app/api and src/lib clients
parallel_execution.shared_files: Type definitions in src/types/ are READ-ONLY during parallel execution - no modifications

frontend_on_backend: API contracts must be implemented by backend before frontend can test
Type definitions must be complete before component development
backend_on_frontend: None - backend can develop independently using API contracts

testing_strategy.unit_tests: Jest + React Testing Library for components (Frontend)
testing_strategy.integration_tests: API route testing with mocked external services (Backend)
testing_strategy.e2e_tests: Playwright for full user flows (Shared, run after both agents complete)

performance_optimization.code_splitting: Dynamic imports for non-critical components (InfraNodusGraph, ConceptCloud)
performance_optimization.image_optimization: Next.js Image component with AVIF/WebP formats
performance_optimization.font_optimization: next/font for Inter and Fira Code with preloading

accessibility_requirements.keyboard_navigation: All interactive elements must be keyboard-accessible
accessibility_requirements.screen_readers: Proper ARIA labels and semantic HTML
accessibility_requirements.color_contrast: 4.5:1 minimum for text, 3:1 for UI components
accessibility_requirements.focus_indicators: Visible focus styles on all focusable elements
accessibility_requirements.testing: Automated testing with axe-core, manual testing with VoiceOver

immediate: Agent 3a (Claude Frontend) receives this architecture document
Agent 3b (Claude Backend) receives this architecture document
Both agents execute in parallel, creating files according to task allocation

handoff_to_agent_3a.expected_output: 3a_claude_frontend_output.json with all frontend components and tests

handoff_to_agent_3b.expected_output: 3b_claude_backend_output.json with all API routes, clients, and documentation

integration_phase.description: After both Agent 3a and 3b complete, Agent 4 (Gemini CLI) will integrate outputs
integration_phase.validation: Verify type consistency, API contract compliance, test coverage
integration_phase.final_steps: Build production bundle, run E2E tests, deploy to Vercel
